Package com.visionspace.taskmanager.impl.store

Interface TaskStore

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.AutoCloseable
All Known Implementing Classes:
InMemoryTaskStore
public interface TaskStore
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
Interface for a task store. A task store is a container with all the tasks managed by the task manager, and that is shared by all task manager nodes. In order to support a distributed architecture, the task store must be persisted in external storage.

In addition to persisting the task state, the task store is also responsible for notifying its listeners (typically the task launchers) whenever a task state changes. These notifications must be broadcast to all nodes.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addTaskListener​(TaskChangeListener listener)
    Adds a TaskChangeListener to the current store.
    void cancelTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
    Makes the state change for when a task is cancelled, i.e., state changes to TaskState.FAILED and TaskStateInfo.wasCancelled() set to true.
    boolean claimTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
    Claims a task in an atomic operation, changing the task from the TaskState.QUEUED state to the TaskState.RUNNING state if the claim operation succeeds.
    void close()
    Releases resources used by the task store.
    java.lang.String createTask​(TaskDescriptor descriptor, long intendedStartTime)
    Creates a task.
    void failTask​(java.lang.String taskId, java.lang.Exception error)
    Makes the state change for when a task finishes with error, i.e., state changes to TaskState.FAILED and TaskStateInfo.wasCancelled() set to false.
    TaskHandle getTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
    Gets the handles for a given task.
    java.util.stream.Stream<TaskHandle> getTasks()
    Gets handles for all the tasks in the store.
    void removeTaskListener​(TaskChangeListener listener)
    Removes an existing TaskChangeListener of the current store.
    void succeedTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
    Makes the state change for when a task finishes successfully, i.e., state changes to TaskState.SUCCESS.

  • Method Details

    • getTasks

      java.util.stream.Stream<TaskHandle> getTasks()
      Gets handles for all the tasks in the store.
      Returns:
      The tasks.

    • getTask

      TaskHandle getTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
      Gets the handles for a given task.
      Parameters:
      taskId - The id of the task for which the handle is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The task handle.

    • createTask

      java.lang.String createTask​(TaskDescriptor descriptor, long intendedStartTime)
      Creates a task. The created task will be in the TaskState.QUEUED state.
      Parameters:
      descriptor - The task descriptor-
      intendedStartTime - The intended started time, in UTC.
      Returns:
      The taskId of the created task.

    • claimTask

      boolean claimTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
      Claims a task in an atomic operation, changing the task from the TaskState.QUEUED state to the TaskState.RUNNING state if the claim operation succeeds. In case of concurrent claim operations, only one of them succeeds.
      Parameters:
      taskId - The task to claim.
      Returns:
      true if the task was claimed, false otherwise.

    • cancelTask

      void cancelTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
      Makes the state change for when a task is cancelled, i.e., state changes to TaskState.FAILED and TaskStateInfo.wasCancelled() set to true.
      Parameters:
      taskId - The task that was cancelled.

    • failTask

      void failTask​(java.lang.String taskId, java.lang.Exception error)
      Makes the state change for when a task finishes with error, i.e., state changes to TaskState.FAILED and TaskStateInfo.wasCancelled() set to false.
      Parameters:
      taskId - The task that failed.

    • succeedTask

      void succeedTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
      Makes the state change for when a task finishes successfully, i.e., state changes to TaskState.SUCCESS.
      Parameters:
      taskId - The task that succeeded.

    • addTaskListener

      void addTaskListener​(TaskChangeListener listener)
      Adds a TaskChangeListener to the current store. The listener will receive events that take place after registering.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to add.

    • removeTaskListener

      void removeTaskListener​(TaskChangeListener listener)
      Removes an existing TaskChangeListener of the current store. The listener will stop receiving events from this point on.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to remove.

    • close

      void close()
      Releases resources used by the task store. The closed store should not be used again.
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
